main event: Multiple witnesses, including teenagers and an adult, observed a bright silver, round object that made sharp turns and accelerated at high speeds over Milwaukee, Wisconsin on March 24, 1954.
interesting points: The object was described as being 8-10 feet in diameter and appeared to be metallic.
The object was observed to make sharp turns and accelerate at high speeds.
Five minutes after the object disappeared, two single-engine military aircraft were observed passing over the area at low altitude.
Weather conditions at the time included low wispy clouds, moderate winds, and unlimited visibility.
The investigating officer concluded that the observed object could not be identified and was an unidentified flying object.
witnesses: two young boys, a neighbor, and a 62-year-old wholesale appliance dealer
